caption: If you have an hour or two to spare before heading back to the Eurotunnel and you have kids, you couldn't find a much better place for them to have fun and learn a little history along the way. There's lots of hands on things for kids to do from dressing up in viking costumes or as Henry VIII to playing old style games.

End of our holiday, camped up and stumbled upon this place and it looked shut.  Had a go at the door and what a little gem of a place to while away a couple of hours.  Couldn't buy an aperol spritz for what they charged entrance fee.  Fantastic staff put our fresh cake in the fridge while we did the tour.  Interesting for kids and adults alike.  History of Guines from viking times Kept us entertained while we wait for tunnel crossing tomorrow.
This was a very interesting trip! Not a very big place but the kids loved getting hands on and trying on the outfits and playing the games! The boat was fab too

I'm not even sure if I want to give it 4 stars, it should be 5, and it's not management's fault. But with the corona rules in place we couldn't touch the items we could have. They have interesting and in-depth information useful to my history-buff partner and enough child friendly activities for my active 3.5 year old.
A great little town museum. Very friendly welcome in English. Interesting exhibits on the Field of the Cloth of Gold and a great video/film on the Viking origins of the town
Some information about the history and times of the town. Ideal for families.

A lovely museum with great presentations and friendly staff. The longboat 'journey' is worth the entrance on its own and my daughters enjoyed the experience and finding out some local history. Highly recommended

The good: Fun place to visit, also with kids. Dress up in medieval clothes and playing old games is cool. Very helpful and friendly staff (which is why I gave 4 stars instead of 3). The bad: not a lot of stuff to see. Some games, a documentary film, walking around the the tower, 10 minutes of looking at old clothes and weapons and that's it. You could probably do it in under an hour. Still, if you're near and have kids, worth a visit
Good day out with the grandkids they loved how interactive it was,  plenty to look at and play with. Bigger than it looks inside

Small museum, good for to entertainment in bad weather days. The best for me it's the first floor Where kids and adults can play with antiques games , wear customes. The negative part they have a Viking boat with a movie and it's in French and not clear English.  It's a little bit boring for small kids.
Good
Brilliant fun!

Place visited today.  The receptionist is very smiling. Superb discovery.  Interesting Viking video.  Explanations for all ages.  Very beautiful, well restored tower.  The historical part was very captivating. I recommend ++++

A really great museum. First, a film shows how the town was founded by the Vikings. Then the English were present. It's so much fun to take part in the many hands-on stations. A museum especially great for children
A very good visit, very good to do with children because there are quite a few activities... ideal when it rains

A place to frequent and promote without moderation, we had a good time there with our 6 year old grandson, it is well done and the tour route is excellent. Welcome with a smile and explanation of the concept of visit with its "discovery" rooms where the child can touch and understand everything, drawing and cutting possible, possibility of dressing up in period clothing and adapted weapons and helmet, room with a short film on the life of a Viking and his longship, possibility of going to the promontory of the tower and its panorama of the city and to finish with the "historic" rooms of the Cloth of Gold camp. You are in control of the timing of your visit and you will have a good time there if you know how to observe, children welcome!!
Friendly staff, small museum where children and adults can dress up, we discover lots of interesting things, it's something to do.

Very interesting place retracing the story of a Viking ancestor who reached Guines.  Small museum bringing together paintings, dress accessories and retracing this entire history through panels. Short film watched on a fictitious longship but simulating sea waves. Ideal for children, this museum where you can dress up, play and touch. Very pleasant staff.  Fair price. Allow around an hour and a half inside the museum.  Car parks nearby

Very nice little museum to do with the children. I deliberately say ‚Äúdo‚Äù rather than visit, because here, we touch, we listen, we play and even we dress up! My 5 year old and 3 year old loved it and we may even go back for a few more years!
Very nice discovery! Very enriching museum content and very fun approach. The children had a great time while learning anecdotes from our History. I highly recommend.
Fun and entertaining museum for both children and adults.  The reconstruction of half a longship is brilliant. A true immersion in the history of Gu√Ænes, Pas de Calais and France. Well done b
Beautiful little museum to do with the family, suitable for young and old alike, provision of costumes for young and old, great welcome and explanation, to do if you are passing through!!

My son loved it, dressing up as a knight, creating a 3D hot air balloon and the museum is well done with paintings of kings etc., old games, you can touch everything. Small downside, film about a longship whose engine was broken, too bad but it was great
Original place, very friendly and fun.  Very pleasant staff
Museum to do with the family, a large part is done inside, young and old can even dress up
The kids had a great time, and so did we! Thank you to the team for the warm welcome.
Great museum, it's not a simple visit but real fun for young and old alike. I recommend!!
Great museum, I'm happy to have discovered this place with my family, there are quite a few activities on site and the supervisory staff are very friendly.

Superb first experience this afternoon with 5 children (from 3 to 9 years old). Unlike most museums, the kids can touch everything. We loved it and are thinking of coming back and introducing it to those around us.

Impeccable for a rainy afternoon. The children were able to dress up and go to war. Great discovery of Viking origins during the expansion of the town. A history lesson with the meeting of the cloth of gold camp. And the making of the medal to finish. What else? as Georges would say
Ideal for learning while having fun, for young and old.
Very interactive with children. To visit
2 hours of laughter, learned a bit Kids liked it, that's the most important thing Movie is a bit boring and long for the children...
Perfect place to discover the history of playful Gu√Ænes. Amusing.  Enriching. Pleasant staff.
Very nice experience to do as a family, with reasonable prices.
Wonderful time spent with family, I highly recommend it. Very playful. Old games, costumes...
Wonderful and very interesting Great for children aged 5 to 12
A good time spent with my 4 and 5 year old children. A favorite for the longship üëç ‚Ä¶
